intro: Hieracium viridilimbatum, commonly known as the green-leaf hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a distinctive greenish hue, giving it its common name. Hieracium viridilimbatum is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types.
